data.title: Vino Tinto Espanole
data.text: Tired of being Zinned to death?  Try this change of 'place'  Riaza wine bar offers a taste of Spain with their selection of wines.  The Torrontes is a white (amber) wine and makes a great mango sangria.  They also offer a Dolce, which is like a port.  The bar is small, a few tables indoor & outside.  The Spanish olives are to die for and much different from the salty vinegar Italian style.  So good - We always pick up a couple jars when we stop.  Street parking or nearby public lots.

data.title: Spanish Wine Goodness
data.text: Everyone knows this regions for its Zins, but Riaza's Spanish varietals like Tempranillo & Granciano give them a run for the money.  Accompanied by addictive almonds and a mix of tasty olives, this quaint tasting room is a great stop in downtown Lodi for anyone needing to reset their palate with easy to drink white and red wines.
